{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3504479,"name":"","username":"drkowalski82","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/94ad74/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-06T23:08:58.065Z","cooked":"

We have been searching for a straightforward “How to turn your Timed Based Subsystems into Command Based code” that is easy enough for a second year student to understand. The change from a Tank Drive timed robot to a Swerve drive Command based on Robot Container has become a bit too complicated for our young programmers. A lot of the examples online have added information like logging an additional subsystems that determining the minimum what is really needed for the conversion becomes difficult. Any advice on resources would be appreciated.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-02-07T00:40:00.076Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":22,"reads":68,"readers_count":67,"score":123.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":485479,"topic_slug":"simple-timed-based-subsystem-to-command-based-code-example","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":72112,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/simple-timed-based-subsystem-to-command-based-code-example/485479/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3504616,"name":"Otto","username":"GreenTomato","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/greentomato/{size}/214780_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-07T01:50:49.351Z","cooked":"

If you’re switching from tank timed robot to command based swerve you probably want to look at example code from whatever swerve library you plan to use. If you don’t have full CTRE components (Cancoders, krakens, falcons, pidgeon, etc.) I recomend using YAGSL, otherwise you should use CTRE Swerve Gen. Both should have code examples of a command based swerve implementation thats a good starting point that should be accessible/findable through thosel inks (YAGSL example might have some extra stuff like path planner and mabye logging?). Also, lots of teams have also shifted away from using Robot Container as its somewhat of an unneeded abstraction (imo) and you can just put everything in Robot.java.

GreenTomato:

Also, lots of teams have also shifted away from using Robot Container as its somewhat of an unneeded abstraction (imo) and you can just put everything in Robot.java.

I wrote RobotContainer, and I’ve been advocating to get rid it for a few years now.

It was an attempt to provide a file separation between imperative and declarative layers of the robot definition, but we should just have a CommandRobot subclass that wires up and hides the periodic boilerplate for you, instead.

Thank you for the links! We are using the REV MaxSwerve with SparkMax Controllers. We started directly with the template on REV (GitHub - REVrobotics/MAXSwerve-Java-Template). I have attempted to convert a simple intake into command based using the FIREBEARS 2024 code as an example, but the command calls are completely different in theirs vs the Template. I have tried a few things, but I can’t seem to make the command call actually work. The format they use is below. I will continue to look through your examples and find some others as well. Thank you!

//FROM THE TEMPLATE
private void configureButtonBindings() {
new JoystickButton(m_driverController, Button.kR1.value)
.whileTrue(new RunCommand(
() → m_robotDrive.setX(),
m_robotDrive));
}
